relating to the economic principles of John Maynard Keynes, especially the importance of having government programmes to encourage employment and spending: Keynesian economics Past governments had followed an orthodox Keynesian approach and had borrowed more money to boost demand. Keynesian noun [ C ]
He considered himself a Keynesian. Keynesianism noun [ U ]
the economic theory known as Keynesianism
